reviews.text: Met Tony Knight for the first time on Saturday. He is a station guard and in addition to his useful announcements, read 2 A.A. Milne poems. He was brilliant. Never in 40+ years of train travel have I encountered anything like it! Keep up the good work Tony. You kept us informed, made us smile and were a terrific ambassador for the station and the services that come through. I hope your management is progressive enough to notice and value the positive impact you can have.
Did not bring the ramp to allow my disabled daughter off the train!!!

No clock in main aitrium - genius.
Automatic doors wide open all the time in freezing weather - genius.
Great little cafe, though - the one star.
So amazingly helpful on a very busy morning , thank you to the platform staff for helping me locate my bag! - beyond the call of duty!
Toilets broken again, the staff at the ticket desk were miserable and unhelpful. No ability to use the accessible toilet as they 'don't know where the key is'.
